original_prompt:
You will be given two sentences. One of them is created by paraphrasing the original one, with changes on an aspect, or using synonyms. Your task is to decide what is the difference between two sentences. Types of change are explained below:
 Tense: The verbs in the sentence are changed in tense.
Number: Plural nouns, verbs and pronouns are changed into single ones or the other way around.
Voice: If the verbs are in active voice, they're changed to passive or the other way around.
Adverb: The paraphrase has one adverb or more than the original sentence.
Gender: The paraphrase differs from the original sentence in the gender of the names and pronouns.
Synonym: Some words or phrases of the original sentence are replaced with synonym words or phrases. Changes in the names of people are also considered a synonym change. Classify your answers into Tense, Number, Voice, Adverb, Gender, and Synonym.
generated_prompts: You will receive two sentences and you must identify the difference between them. Possible changes include: Tense (verbs changed in tense), Number (plural nouns, verbs, or pronouns changed to singular or vice versa), Voice (active to passive or vice versa), Adverb (paraphrase has one adverb or more than the original sentence), Gender (differences in gender of names and pronouns) and Synonym (words or phrases replaced with synonym words or phrases, including changes in the names of people). Your task is to classify the difference into the categories of Tense, Number, Voice, Adverb, Gender, and Synonym.

You will be given two sentences, one of which is a paraphrase of the original. Your task is to identify what aspect of the original sentence has changed. These aspects include: Tense (the verbs have been changed in tense), Number (plural nouns, verbs and pronouns have been changed to single ones or vice versa), Voice (active verbs have been changed to passive or vice versa), Adverb (there are more adverbs in the paraphrase than the original sentence), Gender (the gender of names and pronouns has changed), and Synonym (words and phrases have been replaced with synonyms, including names). Your answer should classify the difference between the two sentences into one of these categories.

You will be presented with two sentences. One sentence is a paraphrase of the original sentence, with changes in one or more aspects. Your task is to identify the difference between the two sentences. Types of change include changes in Tense (verbs), Number (plural nouns, verbs and pronouns), Voice (active to passive or vice versa), Adverb (original sentence has one adverb or more), Gender (names and pronouns) and Synonym (replacing words or phrases with synonyms). Classify your answers into Tense, Number, Voice, Adverb, Gender, and Synonym.

You will be given two sentences, one of which is a modified version of the original sentence. Your task is to identify the difference between the two sentences, and classify your answer as one of the following: Tense, Number, Voice, Adverb, Gender, and Synonym. Tense refers to changes in the verb tense. Number refers to changes in the number of nouns, verbs, and pronouns, from plural to singular or vice versa. Voice is the change from active to passive voice or vice versa. Adverb is the presence of one or more adverbs in the paraphrased sentence. Gender refers to changes in the gender of names and pronouns. Synonym is the replacement of words or phrases with synonyms, or changes in the names of people.

You will be given two sentences, one of which is created by paraphrasing the original one with changes on one or more aspects such as tense, number, voice, adverb, gender, or synonym. Your task is to identify what type of change has been made. If the verbs in the sentence are changed in tense, classify your answer as Tense. If plural nouns, verbs, and pronouns are changed into single ones or the other way around, classify your answer as Number. If the verbs are in active voice, and they are changed to passive or the other way around, classify your answer as Voice. If the paraphrase has one adverb or more than the original sentence, classify your answer as Adverb. If the paraphrase differs from the original sentence in the gender of the names and pronouns, classify your answer as Gender. If some words or phrases of the original sentence are replaced with synonym words or phrases, or the names of people are changed, classify your answer as Synonym.
